Posts.EditableText:
Hi,
I had a look through the help files but i didn't see anything on it. Is there a function for obtaining the previous room.

Thanks for any replies,
Frank
Posts.HTML:
Hi,
I had a look through the help files but i didn't see anything on it. Is there a function for obtaining the previous room.

Thanks for any replies,
Frank

Posts.EditableText:
Quest doesn't have a built-in variable for the last room but it is easy to make one. Quest does have a built-in variable called [i:56tg7tb6]quest.currentroom[/i:56tg7tb6]. For more built-in variables, see [url:56tg7tb6]http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/asl/script-strings.htm[/url:56tg7tb6]

Here's an example that saves the current room in a variable called [i:56tg7tb6]quest.lastroom [/i:56tg7tb6]before each turn. For feedback, it displays the last room after each turn but you can remove that after testing.

[code:56tg7tb6]	beforeturn set string <quest.lastroom; #quest.currentroom#>
	afterturn msg <Last Room was #quest.lastroom#.>[/code:56tg7tb6]

In QDK, [b:56tg7tb6]beforeturn [/b:56tg7tb6]and [b:56tg7tb6]afterturn [/b:56tg7tb6]are set in the Game Properties window. See [url:56tg7tb6]http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/asl/qdk-game.htm[/url:56tg7tb6] for more on Game Properties.
Posts.HTML:
Quest doesn't have a built-in variable for the last room but it is easy to make one. Quest does have a built-in variable called quest.currentroom. For more built-in variables, see http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/asl/script-strings.htm

Here's an example that saves the current room in a variable called quest.lastroom before each turn. For feedback, it displays the last room after each turn but you can remove that after testing.

	beforeturn set string <quest.lastroom; #quest.currentroom#>
	afterturn msg <Last Room was #quest.lastroom#.>


In QDK, beforeturn and afterturn are set in the Game Properties window. See http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/asl/qdk-game.htm for more on Game Properties.
